name: Judy Garland: An Extraordinary Life Online Trivia | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Judy began performing as a child as one of the Gumm sisters. Which one was she?
questions.explanation:
Youngest.

	Little Frances Gumm was known as "Baby Gumm". She started her career early.

questions.text: In her early years Judy made many successful movies for what studio?
questions.explanation:
MGM.

	Louis B. Mayer was in charge. She made a fortune for the studio.

questions.text: Who co-starred with Judy in "The Pirate"?
questions.explanation:
Gene Kelly.

	Kelly also appeared with her in "For Me and My Gal" and in "Summer Stock". Mason was in "A Star is Born". Astaire was in "Easter Parade". Bogarde was in "I Could Go On Singing".

questions.text: Which of these movies did NOT team Judy with Mickey Rooney?
questions.explanation:
Little Nellie Kelly.

	Judy did "Kelly" - but there was no Mickey in this one.

questions.text: Which movie does NOT include Judy in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Three Smart Girls.

	"Girls" starred Deanna Durbin, Judy's contemporary and fellow star during the early days. "Mars" is a musical. "Child" (with Burt LAncaster) and "Singing" (with Dirk Bogarde) are dramas.

questions.text: Which of Judy's co-stars from "The Wizard of Oz" co-starred with her in "The Harvey Girls"?
questions.explanation:
Ray Bolger.

	"On the Atcheson, Topeka and the Santa Fe".

questions.text: Judy expected to win an Oscar for "A Star is Born" - but she didn't win. Who did?
questions.explanation:
Grace Kelly.

	Kelly won for "The Country Girl". Wyman and Dandridge were also nominated. Garland was in the hospital at the time.

questions.text: Liza Minnelli and Lorna Luft are the best known of Judy's children, but she had one other child. Who was the father? All of the choices were married to her at one time or another.
questions.explanation:
Sid Luft.

	The last of Judy's three children was Joey Luft.

questions.text: Judy's tv show never received good ratings. What show was it up against?
questions.explanation:
Bonanza.

	"Bonanza" was a long running monster hit in its day. Judy's show didn't last very long.

questions.text: How old was Judy when she died?
questions.explanation:
Mid-late forties.

	Sadly, she died at age 47.
